skill.name: istio-traffic-management
skill.description: Configure Istio traffic management including routing, load balancing, circuit breakers, and canary deployments. Use when implementing service mesh traffic policies, progressive delivery, or resilience patterns.
skill.summary: Configure Istio traffic management including routing, load balancing, circuit breakers, and canary d...

security_audit.summary: No data theft, malicious execution, or obfuscation patterns detected. The content is static guidance and YAML templates for Istio configuration.

content.value_statement: You need reliable traffic control in a service mesh. This skill provides clear templates for routing, canaries, and resilience.
actual_capabilities: Provide VirtualService routing with header and path matching
Define DestinationRule subsets for versioned services
Set canary weights for progressive delivery
Configure circuit breakers and outlier detection policies
Add retries, timeouts, and traffic mirroring
limitations: Does not apply manifests to a cluster
Requires Istio CRDs and control plane already installed
Does not validate policies against live mesh state

use_cases.title: Standardize routing rules
use_cases.description: Create consistent VirtualService and DestinationRule patterns across teams.

use_cases.title: Improve resilience policies
use_cases.description: Add circuit breakers, retries, and timeouts to reduce cascading failures.

use_cases.title: Run safe canary rollouts
use_cases.description: Set weighted traffic splits for controlled releases.

prompt_templates.title: Basic routing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a VirtualService and DestinationRule for reviews with v1 and v2 subsets. Route user header jason to v2 and others to v1.

prompt_templates.title: Canary rollout
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate Istio manifests for my-service with stable and canary subsets. Use 90 percent stable and 10 percent canary.

prompt_templates.title: Resilience policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a DestinationRule with connection pools and outlier detection for my-service. Also add a VirtualService with retries and timeouts.

prompt_templates.title: Ingress gateway
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Gateway for *.example.com with TLS and a VirtualService that routes /api/v1 to api-service on port 8080.

output_examples.input: Set up a 95 5 canary for payments with stable and canary subsets
output: VirtualService routes payments with 95 percent stable and 5 percent canary
DestinationRule defines stable and canary subsets with version labels
Notes on adjusting weights during rollout

best_practices: Define clear version labels for subsets
Set timeouts and retries with limits
Start canaries with small traffic percentages
anti_patterns: Skipping outlier detection for critical services

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Istio versions
faq.answer: Templates use v1beta1 networking APIs, which are supported in recent Istio releases.

faq.question: What limits should I expect
faq.answer: It does not deploy or validate resources, so cluster access and validation remain your responsibility.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI pipelines
faq.answer: Yes, you can generate manifests and apply them in your existing CI or GitOps flow.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data
faq.answer: No, it only provides static guidance and templates with no data collection.

faq.question: What if my routes do not take effect
faq.answer: Use istioctl analyze and proxy-config commands to inspect config and endpoints.

faq.question: How does it compare to plain Kubernetes Ingress
faq.answer: It adds mesh-aware routing, traffic shaping, and resilience policies beyond standard Ingress.
